website_summaries.verdict: The Klipsch KG-200 Pro Audio wired gaming headset suffers from a complicated setup and poor sound quality, resulting in a frustrating and lackluster experience.

customer_reviews.title: This thing have some mean sound.
customer_reviews.text: They have some lil white noise but when gaming you cant really tell or watching or listening to music. I had some after 4 years i accidentally broke mine so they where on sale and i bought 2 of them. They got some mean bass sound really good to just the mic its meh it could of been better. Best part is that after long time of gaming or doing projects they don't make your ears hurt or exhaust you head. to bad they don't make them any more.
customer_reviews.author: Candace M.

customer_reviews.title: Buyers remorse...taints the Klipsch brand, a pity for me the customer & Klipsch.
customer_reviews.text: Constant Hiss from internal amp, hiss can be masked if you crank it up. *sounds dull, great bass no mids some highs* so not even good for skype intelligible speech, jusk ok for game noises such as engine noise in flight simulator. *EQ & mute use not intuitive, or EQ not effective* **Not klipsch sound, ** IMHO Taints the Klipsch brand name, I wonder how many people bought these and will never get near any other mostly excellent Klipsch products again...a shame. only thing I can say for it is the build quality feels solid.
customer_reviews.author: DThinker

customer_reviews.title: A steal at $20
customer_reviews.text: Wanted these when they came out before I trust Klipsch, saw the bad reviews and went with a set of Hyperx, saw theses year later for $20, They do not fit as well as my Hyperx, they don’t feel as premium as my Hyperx, but they would fantastic, if you need headphones for gaming these are a no brainer at $20
customer_reviews.author: Corey H. Council

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: These were the last wired headset I purchased. I've since untethered myself with wireless headphones, but not because of any defect or lack of quality with this headset, on the contrary it's a solid headset with great sound. I like the detachable mic, guarantees privacy. Comfortable fit. does not hurt my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Bort

customer_reviews.title: Great Mic Qaulity
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically because a friend had a pair and my friends and I all noted that his voice came through Teamspeak with the clearest, cleanest, best quality audio. They can be a little uncomfortable after long use. And I think a friend had gotten a DOA/faulty pair, but that should be the exception not the rule. Overall, great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Good sound when using USB though
customer_reviews.text: Bass is overpowering when using mini plugs. Can't turn it down. Good sound when using USB though. Works well with speech to text if room is quiet. Strong frame and tight fit. Squeeze pressure isn't adjustable. Works well for the cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It was extremely painful to wear these for some time
customer_reviews.text: I was honestly expecting so much more from Klipsch. It was extremely painful to wear these for some time. I eventually got somewhat used to them, but I still feel uncomfortable at times. Sound quality is average, could be the fault of my computer though. These are shameful in comparison to earbuds. Somewhat disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Loud hissing noise on all systems, not what i expected from a klipsh product
customer_reviews.author: Kash Q.

customer_reviews.title: Nice deal
customer_reviews.text: You have to set your volume on PCs really low
customer_reviews.author: JPP

customer_reviews.title: It sounds very bad
customer_reviews.text: It sounds very bad, i can hear noise from integrated amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They seem like great headphones but could not make hearing and speaking work simultaneously with xbox
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of Junk. The cheap rubber cord quickly frayed at multiple spots. Bought in February, useless in May, no longer returnable. $90 flushed down the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: ArtC10509

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: They sound amazing another great sound from klipsch i own klipsch everything and they always knock it out the park when it comes to sound systems. I would recommend these to friends and family
customer_reviews.author: Cristobal Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The only REAL problem is that it consumes batteries LIKE CRAZY. Wow. bad
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Not a reasonable solution with Xbox One.
customer_reviews.text: This had a persistent hiss, probably from being powered by USB. When used with Xbox ONE the volume controls on the earpiece don't function. They are likely fine with other devices/systems. Will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great it you like the volume loud. Low volume gets constant hissing.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Looks great. Good build
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Good build, sturdy , typical Klipsch quality product, but I can not get it to work. I have tried everything but noe sound . I tried to return this item on the 29th day I had it , but Amazon's records did not match mine (mine were correct) , and the return was not authorized . I guess I have a good tech. decoration .
customer_reviews.author: Snixit

customer_reviews.title: Kg-200, great headset, that hisses. Regrettably.
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Fits well and firmly on your noggin with a long enough cable. Sound is nice and sounds well. Really like the ability to change volume for voice and game audio. Con:So far only one. The built in amplifier hisses (creates white noise) any time there is sound. It's less noticeable with music or other louder audio feeds. As soon as you need small noises or very quiet audio output, the hissing is prominent and distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Headset works great. The feedback people have complained about is caused ...
customer_reviews.text: Headset works great. The feedback people have complained about is caused when the microphone is plugged in. Many computers will operate on the USB Connection alone or USB and Headphone Jack. I believe the problem has more to do with the computer than the headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are not the headphones you're looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend these to anyone. I had a really bad buzzing noise no matter what I plugged them into. I tried 2 different laptops and my desktop still the same buzz. I ended up buying a set from Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Berg

customer_reviews.title: these are terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Guys, save your time and money, get a different header, these are terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Donovan G.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Wires galore, sound is sub par, and microphone is inoperable. Every time I would plug in the microphone it would either cut out and or make a buzzing noise on the other end. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: John Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Research before buying this headset.
customer_reviews.text: These are only wireless for PC & PS3. The cord they give you for the Xbox One works (you'll need a 3rd party mic adapter too). However, the headset isn't aware that there is an audio signal going to it, so it shuts off automatically every tens minutes. There is no way to disable that automatic shut off. It's a major design flaw & an inconvenience. The audio & chat is good. This headset takes batteries because it's originally a wireless headset. It is inconvenient having to have it plugged in & still having to change battery's. If you're going to offer multiple ways to use a headset, then they have to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nelly

customer_reviews.title: Iron maiden for your head
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the most uncomfortable headset that I have ever worn. Save your self some money and steer clear. If you are looking for something cheap go Sades if you are looking for something more expensive there are a thousand better headsets out there than this uncomfortable atrocity.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: So So... KG-200 wired.
customer_reviews.text: I bought them and returned them because the low volume static pulsing/white noise on both the Xbox One and PC. The sound quality is pretty decent for gaming. Not that great for music. I'm a huge Klipsch fan but I just couldn't deal with the static. I ended up going with the PC version of the Astro A40 for just a little more money. Would highly recommend looking at those for comfort and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Klipsch sound for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This unit has excellent sound with great sound and good spatial separation. When gaming everything seems to be "where" it should be. The microphone quality is excellent sound clear and lifelike for a boom microphone. The headphones were tight when I first bought them, but they have relaxed to fit my head. I have not changed the any of the presets as I only use the gaming one. This is a powered unit, so you will need a usb port to do it. It can be from a pc or a separate usb power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Tullos

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of headphones. It's convenient that it is wireless. It uses 3 AAA batteries in the left ear cup. I had another pair that had the microphone near the ear piece and people had trouble hearing me, so this microphone works much better. It is reasonably comfortable. The sound quality is good. They do enhance the gaming experience. ETA: I let a friend use these and he was very impressed. He likes that it blocks outside noises letting you really escape into the game. He felt the quality of the sound was outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: reg

customer_reviews.title: Too many quirks and disappointments to be recommended
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Lightweight -Works with a wide variety of devices -Surround sound, mic monitoring and second headset features CONS: -Headband doesn’t tighten enough -Poor mesh cushioning -Not compatible with Xbox One out-of-the-box You better get this one instead:
customer_reviews.author: Electro

customer_reviews.title: These are a really nice set of gaming headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are a really nice set of gaming headphones. I say gaming headphones because unlike my previous pair of Turtle Beach headphones, these can only be used for gaming and cannot be used just to listen to music or in conjunction with your cellphone. While I prefer the multiple uses of the Turtle Beach headphones, I really do like these. The sound was great and they fit comfortably on my ears. I am not entirely sure they are worth the price but if that is the way your heading then you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J. Tidline

customer_reviews.title: Amazing EQ
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing feature of Klipsch KG-300 is four preset EQs (Fidelity, Combat, Stealth, and Sport). They are available with versions optimized for both surround sound and stereo. My favorite, "Stealth" which the manual describes as "Clean highs and clear mids enhance every detail around you", is the best preset for playing xbox "HALO". Klipsch KG-300 is truly design for gaming!
customer_reviews.author: Pikmin

product_meta.title: Klipsch KG-200 Gaming Headphone, Black
product_meta.description: Style Name:wiredAs makers of legendary headphones and the world's best home and pro cinema speakers, our acoustic geniuses have created the Klipsch KG-200, the most powerful, ultra-comfortable and acoustically detailed gaming headset your ears have ever worn. Dominate your play with a true audio advantage that immerses you completely and shifts the game in your favor. The Klipsch KG-200 headset has been custom voiced with four gaming EQs so you hear every crucial sound with critical detail. Designed for use with PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, Xbox One (3rd party adapter required) and PCs, the wired KG-200 provides listeners with athletic mesh ear pads for long-term wear, comfort and breathability while still providing superior levels of noise isolation. Equipped with 40mm precision-tuned drivers and four selectable EQ presets (Fidelity, Combat, Stealth and Sport), the headset delivers optimized sound for every game type. Large, easily-accessible controls are located on the right ear cup for controlling EQ, chat volume, game volume and Mic monitor.
feature_bullets: Wide-field stereo imaging and life-like detail from a robust digital amplifier and 40mm drivers that are precision tuned for gaming
Athletic mesh earpads that breathe to keep you cool and comfortable for hours
Precision-Flex boom noise filtering Mic that is adjustable, detachable and auto adjust levels
Ear mounted controls for chat volume, game volume, Mic monitoring and EQ
Designed for use with PlayStation 4, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360, and PC

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars64 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
